|footnotes = |website = http://www.lhcaz.gov/ }} '''Lake Havasu City''' is a city in [[Mohave County, Arizona|Mohave County]], [[Arizona]], [[United States]]. According to 2010 Census Bureau estimates, the population of the town is 52,527. It is served by [[Lake Havasu City Airport]]. Lake Havasu City is geographically isolated from the other cities in Mohave County.<ref>http://www.co.mohave.az.us/</ref>
==History== The community first started as an Army Air Corps rest camp during World War II on the shores of [[Lake Havasu]]. Lake Havasu City was established in 1963 by [[Robert P. McCulloch]] (of [[McCulloch Motors Corporation|McCulloch]] chainsaws) as a [[planned community]]. McCulloch had purchased {{convert|3,500|acre|km2}} of property on the east side of [[Lake Havasu]] along Pittsburgh Point, the peninsula that eventually would be transformed into "the island". The city was incorporated in 1978.
===London Bridge=== A tourist attraction in Lake Havasu City is the [[London Bridge (Lake Havasu City)|London Bridge]], which crosses a 930 ft (280 m) long man-made canal that leads from [[Lake Havasu]] (on the [[Colorado River (U.S.)|Colorado River]]) to Thompson Bay. It was bought for US $2.5 million from the [[City of London]] when the bridge was replaced in 1968. The bridge was disassembled, and the marked stones were shipped to Lake Havasu City and reassembled for another US $7 million. It opened in October 1971.
The London Bridge is the second most visited tourist attraction in Arizona, behind only the [[Grand Canyon]].
===Events=== Lake Havasu City is an active destination for a wide range of people. During the spring months, the community is joined by university students during [[Spring Break]]. With its reputation as a party community, Lake Havasu has twice been featured during MTV's Spring Break coverage.<ref name="imdb.com">[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0889616/]</ref> For boaters, March to September are the prime months on Lake Havasu. The city is also home to the International World Jet Ski Final Races, multiple professional fishing tournaments, custom boat regattas, the Western Winter Blast pyrotechnics convention, Havasu 95 Speedway, the Havasu Triathlon,<ref>http://www.tucsonracing.com/ Tucson Racing Inc., retrieved 2010-06-18.</ref> the Havasu Half Marathon<ref>http://www.havasuhalf.com retrieved 2010-06-18.</ref> and the Havasu Island Hot Air Balloon Fest & Fair. <ref>www.havasuballoonfest.com</ref>
During the winter months, the community is joined by retirees from colder regions of the country and Canada. During this period, multiple events are held on McCulloch Boulevard.
==Geography== Lake Havasu City is located at {{coord|34|29|24|N|114|18|32|W|city}}.{{GR|1}}
According to the [[United States Census Bureau]], the city has a total area of {{convert|43.1|sqmi|km2}}, of which, {{convert|43.0|sqmi|km2}} of it is land and {{convert|0.04|sqmi|km2}} of it (0.07%) is water.
The only access to Lake Havasu City by road is via [[Arizona State Route 95]], which meets [[Interstate 40]] to the north of the city and [[Interstate 10]] to the south. C.V. Wood, who designed Disneyland, was hired by Robert McCulloch to lay out Lake Havasu's unique road system.<ref>[http://www.roadsideamerica.com/tip/2767]</ref>

The city has extremely hot [[summer]]s, with highs remaining between 108Â°F and 124Â°F (42Â°C - 51Â°C). Highs above 122Â°F (50Â°C) are not rare in the city during the summer months. ==Demographics== {{USCensusPop |1980=15909 |1990=24363 |2000=41938 |estyear=2009 |estimate=55667 }} As of the [[census]]{{GR|2}} of 2000, there were 41,938 people, 17,911 households, and 12,716 families residing in the city. The [[population density]] was 974.4 people per square mile (376.2/kmÂ²). There were 23,018 housing units at an average density of 534.8 per square mile (206.5/kmÂ²). The racial makeup of the city was 94.35% [[Race (United States Census)|White]], 0.31% [[Race (United States Census)|Black]] or [[Race (United States Census)|African American]], 0.69% [[Race (United States Census)|Native American]], 0.58% [[Race (United States Census)|Asian]], 0.10% [[Race (United States Census)|Pacific Islander]], 2.51% from [[Race (United States Census)|other races]], and 1.46% from two or more races. 7.86% of the population were [[Race (United States Census)|Hispanic]] or [[Race (United States Census)|Latino]] of any race.
There were 17,911 households out of which 22.5% had children under the age of 18 living with them, 59.4% were [[Marriage|married couples]] living together, 7.7% had a female householder with no husband present, and 29.0% were non-families. 22.8% of all households were made up of individuals and 11.8% had someone living alone who was 65 years of age or older. The average household size was 2.32 and the average family size was 2.69.
In the city the population was spread out with 19.4% under the age of 18, 5.7% from 18 to 24, 21.6% from 25 to 44, 27.7% from 45 to 64, and 25.5% who were 65 years of age or older. The median age was 48 years. For every 100 females there were 96.8 males. For every 100 females age 18 and over, there were 94.3 males.
The median income for a household in the city was $36,499, and the median income for a family was $41,393. Males had a median income of $31,594 versus $21,576 for females. The [[per capita income]] for the city was $20,403. About 6.6% of families and 9.5% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 15.8% of those under age 18 and 5.2% of those age 65 or over.
In 2007, Lake Havasu was named one of the Top 100 places to live in America by RelocateAmerica.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.bizjournals.com/phoenix/stories/2007/04/16/daily39.html?f=et73&hbx=e_du | title=Four Arizona cities make list of best places to live | date=April 19, 2007}}</ref> CNN has also listed the community among their top retirement cities in the country.
==Education== Lake Havasu City is served by the [[Lake Havasu Unified School District]].<ref>[http://www.havasu.k12.az.us/ LHUSD Website]</ref> There are currently six elementary schools, one middle school, two high schools, and several alternative schools in the city. At the end of the school year the district is undergoing strict budget cuts, removing Daytona Middle School, distributing the 6th grade throughout the elementaries and 7th and 8th grade to the other middle school. In a 2008 nationwide survey, Forbes magazine ranked Lake Havasu City "The Least Educated City in America", coming up last in the number of college graduates living in the city.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.forbes.com/2008/11/24/economics-education-colorado-biz-beltway-cx_jz_1124educated_slide_12.html?thisSpeed=15000 | work=Forbes | first=Joshua | last=Zumbrun | title=In Pictures: America's Best- And Worst-Educated Cities}}</ref>
A campus of [[Mohave Community College]] is located in Lake Havasu City. Arizona State University has announced plans to build a new 4-year college campus in downtown Lake Havasu City to open in October of 2012.
==Government== The City operates under a council-manager form of government. The Mayor and six Councilmembers are elected to staggered four-year terms. The City Council sets the City's policy and direction, and appoints the City Manager who is tasked with the responsibility for carrying out Council policies and administering the day-to-day operations. Per the City Code, the Department Directors are appointed by the City Manager. <ref>[http://www.lhcaz.gov/aboutUs.html]</ref>
As of November, 2008, 64 percent of registered voters in Lake Havasu City are Republican, 35 percent Democrat, and the remaining 1 percent Independent.<ref>[http://www.bestplaces.net/city/Lake_Havasu_City-Arizona.aspx#]</ref>
Lake Havasu City hosted the final appreciation dinner for retiring United States Senator [[Barry Goldwater]], the 1964 Republican Party presidential nominee, at the Nautical Inn Convention Center on October 21, 1986.<ref>[http://wapedia.mobi/en/Evan_Mecham]</ref>

==Popular culture== ''[[Day of the Wolves]]'' is a 1971 heist movie starring [[Richard Egan]]. It was directed, written and produced by Ferde Grofe Jr.. It was the first movie to be made on location in the new town of Lake Havasu City, Arizona.<ref>[[Day of the Wolves]]</ref>
The London Bridge's relocation to Arizona was the basis of a 1985 made for TV movie ''[[Bridge Across Time]]'' (also known as Arizona Ripper or Terror at London Bridge), directed by E.W. Swackhamer and starring [[David Hasselhoff]] and [[Stepfanie Kramer]]. In the film, a series of murders in Lake Havasu is attributed to the spirit of [[Jack the Ripper]], whose soul is transported to America in one of the bricks of the London Bridge.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0088852/]</ref>
''Savage Beach'', a soft core adult movie, was filmed in Lake Havasu in 1989. Directed by [[Andy Sidaris]], the movie featured [[Playboy]] magazine centerfold models [[Dona Speir]] and [[Hope Marie Carlton]].<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0098257/]</ref>
''Guns'', another soft core adult movie, was filmed in Lake Havasu in 1990. Directed by [[Andy Sidaris]], the movie plot involved a South American gunrunner, and a squad of beautiful government agents sent to put him out of business.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0099720/]</ref>
''Hard Hunted'', a third soft core adult movie directed by [[Andy Sidaris]] was filmed in Lake Havasu in 1992. The plot involved a nuclear trigger being smuggled to the Mid East, putting the global balance of power in jeopardy. The movie featured [[Playboy]] magazine centerfold [[Dona Speir]].<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0104391/]</ref>
MTV featured Lake Havasu during their Spring Break coverage in 1995 and 2004.<ref name="imdb.com"/>
The comedy-adventure ''Border to Border'' was filmed in Lake Havasu in 1998. Actor [[Curtis Armstrong]] and Lisa Arturo were the leads, with a cameo by porn star [[Ron Jeremy]].<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0131327/#comment]</ref>
''[[Piranha 3-D]]'' was filmed in Lake Havasu in 2009. The city was called Lake Victoria in the film. It was directed by Alexandre Aja and starred [[Elisabeth Shue]], [[Kelly Brook]], [[Richard Dreyfuss]], [[Jerry O'Connell]], and [[Christopher Lloyd]]. The film is a remake of the 1978 film ''[[Piranha (1978 film)|Piranha]]''. It debuted in Lake Havasu on Thursday, August 19, 2010, and was released nationally on August 20, 2010.<ref>[http://www.imdb.com/title/tt0464154/]</ref>
